timeline.bodyText: Can anyone help me how to implement this isPresent check (violation is, that the following get() is used without checking if the value is present)

timeline.message: Try to describe why UnsupportedOperationException is ignored

timeline.bodyText: I don't like having these superfluous parenthesis in our code. They add little except almost empty lines.
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: but i do not think they are sonar related - sonar is not complaining about those in the gui
replies.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText:
Maybe I just saw this while doing something else in the code and edited it then. For me (personally) they improve readability of the code. And I like them because I had to debug an massive amount of bugs where at the end it comes down that someone thought "na I don't need parantheses.." and broke the code.
But as @aepfli mentions there is no rule which enforces the one or the other, we can go with both as the author wants to use it.
replies.author: Bukama
Bukama

timeline.bodyText: __ means "nobody cares about this variable" - I want to keep using that.
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText:
Never saw this before and was wondering that it's even allowed. Had to google it up to know that it's a way to show that the variable is not needed.
@aepfli Please change the rule to allow the underscore variables. (two and three underscores are needed)
replies.author: Bukama
Bukama

replies.bodyText: meh than i will add more than 2 _
replies.author: aepfli

timeline.bodyText: The this. are unnecessary, but IMO they improve readability by keeping the three assignments aligned for easy top-down reading.
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: I can follow your argumentation and suggest that @aepfli disables the rule
replies.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: hmm, is there really a rule, i cant find a violation in sonarqube

timeline.bodyText: @nicolaiparlog You were wondering why this was changes and you thought it was because the lower case at the start of the line. No it's not. The ; are the violation as sonarcube thinks it's outcommented code, see here
timeline.author: Bukama
